intro: Lappula kulikalonica, commonly known as the Siberian lappula, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Asia, particularly Siberia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread in open landscapes. Lappula kulikalonica is valued for its resilience and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
